interfaces.dataset

Interface DatasetInterface


  • public interface DatasetInterface
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Learning Orchestra
    Summary:
    This interface is responsible for the dataset manipulation, i.e., insertion, update, delete and search.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      com.google.gson.JsonObject await(java.lang.String datasetURL) 
      com.google.gson.JsonObject deleteDatasetAsync(java.lang.String datasetName) 
      com.google.gson.JsonObject deleteDatasetSync(java.lang.String datasetName) 
      com.google.gson.JsonObject insertDatasetAsync(java.lang.String datasetURI, java.lang.String datasetName) 
      com.google.gson.JsonObject insertDatasetSync(java.lang.String datasetURI, java.lang.String datasetName) 
      com.google.gson.JsonObject searchAllDatasets() 
      com.google.gson.JsonObject searchDatasetContent(java.lang.String datasetName) 
      com.google.gson.JsonObject searchDatasetContent(java.lang.String datasetName, int pageSize, int currentPage) 
      com.google.gson.JsonObject updateDatasetAsync(java.lang.String datasetURI, java.lang.String datasetName) 
      com.google.gson.JsonObject updateDatasetSync(java.lang.String datasetURI, java.lang.String datasetName) 

    • Method Detail

      • insertDatasetSync

        com.google.gson.JsonObject insertDatasetSync(java.lang.String datasetURI,
                                             java.lang.String datasetName)
        Parameters:
        datasetURI - is the dataset URI used to find the data in the Web
        datasetName - is the dataset name used inside the Learning Orchestra
        Returns:
        a JSON object with an error or warning message or a URL indicating the correct operation (the caller must use such an URL to perform search operations).
        Summary:
        This method is responsible to insert a dataset from a URI synchronously, i.e., the caller waits until the dataset is inserted into the Learning Orchestra storage mechanism.

      • insertDatasetAsync

        com.google.gson.JsonObject insertDatasetAsync(java.lang.String datasetURI,
                                              java.lang.String datasetName)
        Parameters:
        datasetURI - is the dataset URI used to find the data in the Web
        datasetName - is the dataset name used inside the Learning Orchestra
        Returns:
        a JSON object with an error or warning message or a URL indicating the correct operation (the caller must use such an URL to proceed future checks to verify if the dataset is inserted).
        See Also:
        you must understand the await method description because it is responsible to check if the dataset is inserted or not.
        Summary:
        This method is responsible to insert a dataset from a URI asynchronously, i.e., the caller does not wait until the dataset is inserted into the Learning Orchestra storage mechanism. Instead, the caller receives a JSON object with a URL to proceed future calls to verify if the dataset is inserted.

      • updateDatasetSync

        com.google.gson.JsonObject updateDatasetSync(java.lang.String datasetURI,
                                             java.lang.String datasetName)
        Parameters:
        datasetName - is the dataset name used inside the Learning Orchestra previously in a insertion operation
        datasetURI - is the new URI to be used to change the dataset. If an identical insertion URI is used, no update is performed
        Returns:
        a JSON object with an error or warning message or a URL indicating the correct operation (the caller must use such an URL to perform search operations).
        Summary:
        This method is responsible to update a dataset using a new URI and synchronously, i.e., the caller waits until the dataset is replaced into the Learning Orchestra storage mechanism. The old dataset is removed and the same identification is used for the new one.

      • updateDatasetAsync

        com.google.gson.JsonObject updateDatasetAsync(java.lang.String datasetURI,
                                              java.lang.String datasetName)
        Parameters:
        datasetName - is the dataset name used inside the Learning Orchestra
        datasetURI - is the new URI to be used to change the dataset. If an identical insertion URI is used, no update is performed
        Returns:
        a JSON object with an error or warning message or a URL indicating the correct operation (the caller must use such an URL to proceed future checks to verify if the dataset is updated).
        See Also:
        you must understand the await method description because it is responsible to check if the dataset is updated or not.
        Summary:
        This method is responsible to update a dataset from a URI asynchronously, i.e., the caller does not wait until the dataset is replaced into the Learning Orchestra storage mechanism. Instead, the caller receives a JSON object with a URL to proceed future calls to verify if the dataset is updated.

      • await

        com.google.gson.JsonObject await(java.lang.String datasetURL)
        Parameters:
        datasetURL - is the dataset URL returned by asynchronous method calls of Learning Orchestra API
        Returns:
        a JSON object indicating if the dataset is inserted/updated correctly or a null result
        See Also:
        the method insertDatasetAsync because it must be called before this method call, the method updateDatasetAsync because it must be called before this method call
        Summary:
        This method is responsible to lock the caller until a dataset is inserted or updated correctly into Learning Orchestra

      • deleteDatasetSync

        com.google.gson.JsonObject deleteDatasetSync(java.lang.String datasetName)
        Parameters:
        datasetName - represents the dataset name
        Returns:
        a JSON object with an error message, a warning message or a correct delete message
        Summary:
        This method is responsible for deleting the dataset. This delete operation is synchronous, so it locks the caller until the deletion finished. If a dataset was used by another task (Ex. projection, histogram, pca, tune and so forth), it cannot be deleted.

      • deleteDatasetAsync

        com.google.gson.JsonObject deleteDatasetAsync(java.lang.String datasetName)
        Parameters:
        datasetName - represents the dataset name
        Returns:
        a JSON object with an error message, a warning message or a correct delete message
        Summary:
        This method is responsible for deleting the dataset. This delete operation is asynchronous, so it does not lock the caller until the deletion finished. Instead, it returns a JSON object with a URL for a future use. The caller uses the URL for delete checks. If a dataset was used by another task (Ex. projection, histogram, pca, tune and so forth), it cannot be deleted.

      • searchAllDatasets

        com.google.gson.JsonObject searchAllDatasets()
        Returns:
        all datasets metadata stored in Learning Orchestra or an empty result
        Summary:
        This method retrieves all datasets metadata, i.e., it does not retrieve the dataset content.

      • searchDatasetContent

        com.google.gson.JsonObject searchDatasetContent(java.lang.String datasetName,
                                                int pageSize,
                                                int currentPage)
        Parameters:
        datasetName - is the name of the dataset
        pageSize - is the number of tuples or registers returned per page. It is an optional parameter. If not present, the page size will be 20 tuples/registers.
        currentPage - is the page where the search will start. It is an optional parameter. If not present, the search operation will start from page zero.
        Returns:
        a page with some tuples or registers inside or an error if there is no such dataset. The current page is also returned to be used in future content requests.
        Summary:
        This method is responsible for retrieving pages of the dataset content

      • searchDatasetContent

        com.google.gson.JsonObject searchDatasetContent(java.lang.String datasetName)
        Parameters:
        datasetName - is the name of the dataset
        Returns:
        a page with the first 20 tuples or registers inside or an error if there is no such dataset.
        Summary:
        This method is responsible for retrieving the dataset content, precisely the first 20 tuples
